div.p: This case-insensitive code system http://smart.who.int/ig/smart-immunizations-measles/CodeSystem/IMMZ-D1 defines the following codes:

tr.td: Indicates if the client has received a birth dose and/or supplementary dose

Indicates if the client has completed the primary vaccination series of a product/antigen. If the client has not yet completed their primary series, it means they may be expected to receive more doses to complete their vaccination regimen for the respective product/antigen.
Date when primary vaccination series was completed
The date when the client completed the primary vaccination series (per product/antigen)
The current human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) status of the client
The client is known to be HIV positive
The client is known to be HIV negative
The client's HIV status is unknown
The client is known to be immunocompromised or immunosuppressed. This means the client has a weakened immune system and having a reduced ability to fight infections and other diseases
The client is currently receiving antiretroviral therapy (ART)
Type of TB infection test performed
The type of TB infection test performed
Records the result of the TB infection test
The infant is known to be exposed to HIV (i.e. born to an HIV-infected woman)
Represents the client's birth weight value measures in grams
The type of the polio vaccine dose administered to the client
Age in years when client received first DTP dose
The client's age in years when they received their first diphtheria-tetanus-pertussis (DTP) dose
Age in months when client received first Hib dose
The client's age in months when they received their first Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) dose
The client is known to have a sickle-cell disease
Age in months when client received third pneumococcal dose
The client's age in months when they received their third pneumococcal dose
The client is known to have no history of intussusception
Previous rotavirus doses given were the same product
Indicates whether or not all of the client's previous rotavirus doses were the same product
The client is known to have achieved immune reconstitution
The client is known to be severely immunocompromised or immunosuppressed
The date on which the client started or restarted antiretroviral therapy (ART)
The type of the last Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine dose administered to the client
Inactivated Vero cell-derived Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine type
Live attenuated Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine type
Live recombinant Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine type
The type of the last tick-borne encephalitis (TBE) vaccine dose administered
FSME-Immun vaccine product, which is an inactivated whole-virus vaccine for tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
Encepur vaccine product, which is an inactivated viral vaccine for tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
TBE-Moscow vaccine product, which is a vaccine for tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
EnceVir vaccine product, which is a vaccine for tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
The type of the last typhoid vaccine dose administered to the client
The type of the last cholera vaccine dose administered to the client
Killed whole cell (WC) only cholera vaccine
Vaccine contains a mixture of the recombinant B subunit (rBS) of cholera toxin plus killed whole cell (WC)
The type of the last meningococcal vaccine dose administered to the client
Monovalent serogroup A (MenA) conjugate vaccine (5µg) vaccine
Age in months when client received first meningococcal dose
The age in months when client received their first meningococcal dose
Type of last hepatitis A dose
The type of the last hepatitis A vaccine dose administered to the client

Vaccine-induced neutralizing (VNA) antibody level. It is a measured as a serum antibody concentration amount observed from the result of the concentrated, purified cell culture and embryonated egg-based rabies vaccines (CCEEV)
The client is known to be seronegative for dengue

definition.value: Indicates if the client has received a birth dose and/or supplementary dose

Indicates if the client has completed the primary vaccination series of a product/antigen. If the client has not yet completed their primary series, it means they may be expected to receive more doses to complete their vaccination regimen for the respective product/antigen.

display.value: Date when primary vaccination series was completed

definition.value: The date when the client completed the primary vaccination series (per product/antigen)
The client is currently pregnant
The client is currently breastfeeding
The current human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) status of the client
The client is known to be HIV positive
The client is known to be HIV negative
The client's HIV status is unknown
The infant was preterm
The client is known to be immunocompromised or immunosuppressed. This means the client has a weakened immune system and having a reduced ability to fight infections and other diseases
The client is currently receiving antiretroviral therapy (ART)

display.value: Type of TB infection test performed

definition.value: The type of TB infection test performed
Interferon-gamma release assay (IGRA)
Tuberculin skin test (TST)
Records the result of the TB infection test
Test result was positive
Test result was negative
The infant is known to be exposed to HIV (i.e. born to an HIV-infected woman)
Represents the client's birth weight value measures in grams
The type of the polio vaccine dose administered to the client
Inactivated poliovirus vaccine (IPV)
Bivalent oral poliovirus vaccine (bOPV)

display.value: Age in years when client received first DTP dose

definition.value: The client's age in years when they received their first diphtheria-tetanus-pertussis (DTP) dose

display.value: Age in months when client received first Hib dose

definition.value: The client's age in months when they received their first Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) dose
The client is known to have a sickle-cell disease

display.value: Age in months when client received third pneumococcal dose

definition.value: The client's age in months when they received their third pneumococcal dose
The client is known to have no history of intussusception

display.value: Previous rotavirus doses given were the same product

definition.value: Indicates whether or not all of the client's previous rotavirus doses were the same product
The client is known to have achieved immune reconstitution
The client is known to be severely immunocompromised or immunosuppressed
The date on which the client started or restarted antiretroviral therapy (ART)
The type of the last Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine dose administered to the client
Inactivated Vero cell-derived Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine type
Live attenuated Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine type
Live recombinant Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine type
The type of the last tick-borne encephalitis (TBE) vaccine dose administered
FSME-Immun vaccine product, which is an inactivated whole-virus vaccine for tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
Encepur vaccine product, which is an inactivated viral vaccine for tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
TBE-Moscow vaccine product, which is a vaccine for tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
EnceVir vaccine product, which is a vaccine for tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
The type of the last typhoid vaccine dose administered to the client
Typbar-TCV vaccine
Vi polysaccharide (ViPS) vaccine
Ty21a vaccine
The type of the last cholera vaccine dose administered to the client
Killed whole cell (WC) only cholera vaccine
Vaccine contains a mixture of the recombinant B subunit (rBS) of cholera toxin plus killed whole cell (WC)
The type of the last meningococcal vaccine dose administered to the client
Monovalent serogroup A (MenA) conjugate vaccine (5µg) vaccine
Monovalent MenC conjugate vaccine
Quadrivalent conjugate (A,C,W135,Y-D and A,C,W135,Y-CRM) vaccines

display.value: Age in months when client received first meningococcal dose

definition.value: The age in months when client received their first meningococcal dose

display.value: Type of last hepatitis A dose

definition.value: The type of the last hepatitis A vaccine dose administered to the client
Live attenuated hepatitis A vaccine
Inactivated hepatitis A vaccine

Vaccine-induced neutralizing (VNA) antibody level. It is a measured as a serum antibody concentration amount observed from the result of the concentrated, purified cell culture and embryonated egg-based rabies vaccines (CCEEV)
The client is known to be seronegative for dengue
